titleStmt.title: Unis et al. v. admins for Charlton et al.

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: B
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the original.

div1.p: Know all men by those present that we John McC Saylor administrator of James Charlton deceased William Davis and held and firmly bound unto Unis Andrew Reuben and Julius (paupers) in the just and full sum of one hundred dollars to be paid unto the paid Unis. Andrew Reuben and Julius then certain Attorney. Their executors, administrators or assigns for the payment whereof well and truly to be made, we bind ourselves. Our heirs, executors and administrators jointly and severally firmly by these presents. Sealed with on seals and dated this 22d day of March 1847

The Condition of the above obligation is such that whereas the Clerk of the Court of Appeals of Lewisburg has issued a writ of Supersedeas in the name of the Commonwealth to the Sheriff of County directed enumerating the said Sheriff that from all further proceedings on a judgement of the Circuit Superior Court of Law and Chancery for the Country of Rockbridge renders on the 18th day of April 1846 in a cause in which Unis. Andrew Reuben and Julius (who sued as paupers were Plaintiffs and John McC Saylor administrator of James Charlton decd John L Charlton, WB Charlton, Charles Charlton Wm Cannon and Rhoda his wife, Joseph Miller and Matilda his wife. Eugene C Robinson and Lucinda his wife. Wm W Samuels and Juliet his wife. Elizabeth Charlton, Micajah Thompson, Elizabeth Thompson, Matilda Thompson, Eveline Thompson and Belinda Thompson he should altogether supercede, but on the paid heir the said Clerk of the Court of Appeals has endorsed that it is not to be effectual until the petitioners or some one of them shall file in the Clerks office of the Circuit Superior Court of Law and Chancery for Rockbridge County. Loud with sufficient security in the penalty of one hundred dollars conditioned as the law directs and until certificate of the due execution of such bond is endorsed on this writ by the Clerk of said Circuit Court. Now if the said John McC Saylor administrator of James Charlton decd John L. Charlton. WB Charlton, Charles Charlton, Wm Cannon and Rhoda his wife, Joseph Miller and Matilda his wife, Eugene N. Robinson and Lucinda his wife, Wm W Samuels and Juliet his wife. Elizabeth Charlton, Micajah Thompson, Elizabeth Thompson, Matilda Thompson, Eveline Thompson and Belinda Thompson shall. prosecute the said merit with effect or shall well and truly pay the amount

of the judgment aforesaid of the said Circuit Superior Court and all such costs and damages as shall be awarded in case the paid judgment shall be affirmed. Then the above obligation is to be our otherwise it is to remain in full force

Signed, sealed, & acknowledged
John McC Saylor in the presence of
William Davis Eli Phlegar

This day Eli Phlegar one of the subscribing witnesses to the annexed bond personally appears before and the subscriber a Justice of the peace for said County and made oath that John MC Saylor and William Davis the officers, acknowledged tge paine in his presence that he is well acquainted with the circumstance of William Davis the security in said bond and believes that they are good security for the assesment of penalty thereof Given under my hand this 22nd day of March 1847

This day William Davis the security in the annexed bond personally appeared before one the subscriber, a Justice of the Peace for said County and made oath that after the payment of all his just debts and those for which he is found as security and may probably have to pay his estate is worth more than one hundred dollars. Given under my hand this 22d day of March 1847
H McG Kent J.P.
